TopicTitle: [1.2.2] Stock Part Revamp, Update 1.9.6. Released Source Files!

Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, peachoftree said:

I created a zip of all the changes necessary to run this in 1.1.2, you can dowload it here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5l3t4uhkf9bwcbm/VenStockRevamp_1.1.zip?dl=0

To install just put the contents of the zip directly into your gamedata folder.

Changes:

  • Removed the landing legs
  • Removed reflecting windows and solar panels
  • Implemented @lagcity613's patch for the gigantors

All other credit goes to @Ven

License: CC-BY 4.0 International 

Nice, that's gonna be very helpful for people who don't want to search through giant cfgs.

28 minutes ago, mtpatane said:

Any chance you could remove the engines with known gimbal issues too??

i think that that will ensure full functionality. 

I totally would but I have no idea where to start!

Which ones would those be? I haven't seen any issues yet

53 minutes ago, peachoftree said:

Which ones would those be? I haven't seen any issues yet

LV909, terrier, i think the two stronger 0.625 engines, probably the radial engines too. Maybe the skipper, not sure about the others. Their gimbals are confused. AFAIR they only yaw, but do a pitch action when you try to roll (with a single centered engine), maybe it was the other way round. Some work, e.g. the bollards gimbal thrusters.

A whole bunch of engines. I could check the engines and post them back, but idk if it's even worth to do so much work on the configs (especially when you gotta remove 2/3rd of the engines anyway!), instead of just waiting for 1.1.

Edited May 1, 2016 by Temeter

I found the gimbal problem to be most noticeable with the LV-T45 so I removed Ven's mod on just that engine. My impression was that the 2.5 m engines were working correctly - but I could be wrong. 

Has anyone else seen the folding radiators throwing NREs? I took them out (i.e. back to stock) and the NREs stopped. If no one else has seen that problem it is very likely due to something I messed up myself.

Edited May 1, 2016 by Kaa253

On April 10, 2016 at 5:55 PM, Farix said:

I've rechecked in a fresh 1.1 install with just Ven's and Module Manager v2.6.21 running in 64-bit. After testing the 1.25m engines, there was no yaw control on the LV-909 "Terrier", LV-T45 "Swivel", and LV-900 "Beagle". The S3 KS-25 "Vector" and KS-25 "Badger" worked.

Here's the list for 1.25 engines

page 104 contains the discussion 

Edited May 1, 2016 by mtpatane
Adding info

This pack won't be compatible with 1.1 until Ven updates it. The gimbals (as far as I'm aware) are unable to be changed by anyone apart from Ven. Gimbals are tied to an object in the unity editor, so until the pack is updated and the gimbals realigned please take this pack as incompatible. Also there is the issue with docking ports not having an upper attachment node and various other issuses.

Just remember, this is a big pack and 1.1 was a big change so it's best to just wait it out, and when it's ready it's ready. I'm sure Ven won't disappoint

1 hour ago, Chimer4 said:

This pack won't be compatible with 1.1 until Ven updates it. The gimbals (as far as I'm aware) are unable to be changed by anyone apart from Ven. Gimbals are tied to an object in the unity editor, so until the pack is updated and the gimbals realigned please take this pack as incompatible. Also there is the issue with docking ports not having an upper attachment node and various other issuses.

Just remember, this is a big pack and 1.1 was a big change so it's best to just wait it out, and when it's ready it's ready. I'm sure Ven won't disappoint  

Oh yeah I totally understand. 

I was moreso saying is there a way to remove them, like removing the landing legs, so I can still use the other beautiful textures in the mean time. 

Like if the docking ports and gimbaled engines could get the same treatment the landing legs got in this "hold-over" configuration I think it would be more complete, otherwise it's kinda misleading because there's still issues. 

Edited May 1, 2016 by mtpatane
Spelling

I created a comprehensive spreadsheet on which engines are working and which ones are not. You can find it here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16Umo-jRDGDiIhvG5ZWu8So6rVeBwp7tI5wTnGD8xhIs/edit?usp=sharing

I implemented the changes into my comprehensive 1.1 zip, which you can find in my original post on page 106 or can dowload here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5l3t4uhkf9bwcbm/VenStockRevamp_1.1.zip?dl=0

It's all good and I appreciate the effort you're putting in to help out.

21 hours ago, CodeFantastic said:

 Some parts (Mainly the escape tower and parachute dockingport) seem to have INSANE drag.

 

5 hours ago, CodeFantastic said:

Did you happen to solve the drag issue?

In my tests there's no significant difference with or without the escape tower / docking port with chute combo.

The LES does seem to cause a slightly higher drag than  a similar rocket without it, but it amounted to ~340m separation from its twin without the LES tower after a full 14400 tank / Rhino. That's less than 10m/s difference at the end of the first stage burn. In my test there were a few more parts on the rocket without the LES, so they weighed the exact same.

 

 

Edited May 1, 2016 by MalevolentNinja
@MalevolentNinja That could be completely due to the mass of the escape tower + cover too.

1 hour ago, MalevolentNinja said:

 

In my tests there's no significant difference with or without the escape tower / docking port with chute combo.

The LES does seem to cause a slightly higher drag than  a similar rocket without it, but it amounted to ~340m separation from its twin without the LES tower after a full 14400 tank / Rhino. That's less than 10m/s difference at the end of the first stage burn. In my test there were a few more parts on the rocket without the LES, so they weighed the exact same.

The problem I was getting was when I did even the slightest of turns, the rocket would flip out. (only a 5 degree pitch over)

38 minutes ago, CodeFantastic said:

The problem I was getting was when I did even the slightest of turns, the rocket would flip out. (only a 5 degree pitch over)

That sounds like a design issue.

Stock aerodynamics can be pretty brutal when it comes to rocket flipping. I'm assuming it's because of the high lift you even get at low speeds. Good for easy planes, but somewhat tricky when using rockets.

You can temporarily fix gimbaling by changing the gimbal transform from what it is to thrustTransform. That will prevent the nozzle from moving, but it will still give you the pretty, pretty part and also still give you correct gimbaling. This is because some of Ven's engines have their gimbal transforms misaligned compared to the thrust transform (Yup instead of Zup).

@peachoftree you forgot to fix the path patches. That will break any other mods that clone or otherwise reference the landing legs (e.g.).You will need to delete the pathpatches for any models you remove.

 

For the engines, try this: 

@PART[VenLV909b|liquidEngine3|Size3AdvancedEngine|liquidEngineMini|liquidEngine2]:FOR[aFirst]:NEEDS[VenStockRevamp]
{
	@MODULE[ModuleGimbal]
	{
		@gimbalTransformName = thrustTransform
	}
}

I don't recall anyone mentioning what the issue with the Kickback was so the above doesn't fix it.
